intro: Gautiera, commonly known as the Mexican elder or wild elder, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue or black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Gautiera is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitats.
